data.text: @ICTAdvocates Reliable source like WHO and UNICEF locally NPHCDA and state
@KADNAF001 @KidajiHauwabzau @Kaffydancequeen @surayyah__ahmad @kblawanty @HamzyCODE Thank you very much once again Ashafa for being on the chat, we are grateful.

@KADNAF001 @KidajiHauwabzau @Kaffydancequeen @surayyah__ahmad @kblawanty @HamzyCODE Thank you Ashafa for your time and your insights, the chat stops in a moment, should you have anything you want to add please do so.
@ICTAdvocates @KidajiHauwabzau @Kaffydancequeen @surayyah__ahmad @kblawanty @HamzyCODE @WHO @UNICEF_Nigeria @NCDCgov @NphcdaNG Yes if they usually share update promptly
@ICTAdvocates @KidajiHauwabzau @Kaffydancequeen @surayyah__ahmad @kblawanty @HamzyCODE Yes visit WHO, UNICEF, NCDC and NPHCDA daily to get reliable information
@KADNAF001 @KidajiHauwabzau @Kaffydancequeen @surayyah__ahmad @kblawanty @HamzyCODE @WHO @UNICEF_Nigeria @NCDCgov @NphcdaNG Will visiting their webistes to first check help? @KADNAF001?
@KADNAF001 @KidajiHauwabzau @Kaffydancequeen @surayyah__ahmad @kblawanty @HamzyCODE Will visiting their webistes to first check help? @KADNAF001?

@KADNAF001 @KidajiHauwabzau @Kaffydancequeen @surayyah__ahmad @kblawanty @HamzyCODE How can one verify whether a piece of information is truly from the reliable bodies such as @WHO, @NCDCgov, @NphcdaNG, @UNICEF_Nigeria, @UNICEF?
@KADNAF001 @KidajiHauwabzau @Kaffydancequeen @surayyah__ahmad @kblawanty @HamzyCODE Is there any way we can understand the genuity and otherwise of certain information?
